attributes.action: "Do not cut the Territorial Armys Training funds"
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Re-think and re-inburse the full 20 million so that the TA can train as normal. By cutting the TA budget you will cripple it for many years to come. These people volunteer to serve there country, there country should be there to serve them. The one Army phrase that has been fuesed between the regular Army and the TA will be lost. The TA has worked very hard these last few years to support it's regular brothers in arms on over seas deployments, the weekend warrior status has been dispelled and the TA has knitted into the Regular way of life very well but by making these cuts you force a wedge between them again. By April of next year the TA will have lost a large percentage of it's man power where serving personnel will leave during the cut. Re-think and  
Re-inburse !!!

rejection.details:
The Prime Minister, together with the Defence Secretary, the Chief of General Staff and the Chancellor, have been considering proposed savings in the TA budget.

Gordon Brown has concluded, along with the Defence Secretary, CGS and the Chancellor, that an additional £20m would be found from the Treasury Reserve to ensure all normal training for TA members could continue as before.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
